docs.lead_paragraph: It would seem that a season which has proved so fatal to our Southern cities ought not to be an uninstructive one. The yellow fever has raged now these twenty weeks at New-Orleans--one would suppose that unless its origin and causes are wrapped in the most inexplicable mystery, some close observed would succeed in dragging them to light, so that hereafter the plague may be stayed before it crosses the threshold.

headline.main: GREAT BRITAIN.; ASPECT OF THE RUSSIAN QUESTION. Political, Literary, Theatrical and General News.

docs.lead_paragraph: Those who, for the last two months, have been preaching peace, and proclaiming the certainty of a pacific adjustment of the Russo-Turkish dispute, must feel not a little mortified and perplexed at the present aspect of affairs.
docs.snippet: Those who, for the last two months, have been preaching peace, and proclaiming the certainty of a pacific adjustment of the Russo-Turkish dispute, must feel not a little mortified and perplexed at the present aspect of affairs.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. GEO. C. HOWARD, of Churchville, committed suicide on Wednesday morning last, by drowning. He is said to have been an amiable and highly respectable man, well known throughout the Western part of Rochester county. He had recently purchased a farm at Churchville,

headline.main: CONSOLIDATION.; Brooklyn, Williamsburg, and Bushwick--Important Meetig of the Commissioners--Reports of Committees, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Commissioners on Consolidation met, as per adjournment, yesterday morning, at 11 o'clock, in the County Jail, when the following Committees presented their reports as follows: On Division of Wards.--That in the proposed consolidated city, Bushwick shall be entitled to two wards, making the north road running through Bushwick the division of the two wards.

headline.main: OUR CITY EXPENSES.; INTERESTING REPORT OF THE COMPTROLLER. Expenditures in Detail on Account of the City Government, for the Year Ending July 31, 1853. Board of Health. County Contingencies. Confingent Expenses of the Common Council. Carriage Hire for Members of the Common Council. Coroner's Fees. City Inspectors Department. Cleaning Street. Independence. Expenses for the Fourth of July, 1853.

docs.lead_paragraph: We published in the DAILY TIMES, nearly a month ago, the text of the Comptroller's Report on the Expenditures of the City, which he is required by law to make on the eve of every City election We give below, from the Appendix to the same document, some of the items which go to swell the immense aggregate of our City expenses.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM THE CAPITAL.; The Health and Opinions of the President-Movements of Members of the Cabinet. and other Interesting Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The President is in god health and buoyant spitits. He believes that the efforts maaking to disorganize the Democtatic party, and embarrass the administration, will signally fail. The rumored appointment of CUSHING, Commissioner to China, is believed to be unfounded.

byline.original: Special Dispatch to the New - York Daily Times

headline.main: GREAT BRITAIN.; ACCIDENTS AND LOSS OF LIVES. A Ghost Story--Prison Management. MISCELANEOUS NEWS. OUT PARIS CORRESPONDENCE. GOSSIP OF THE FRENCH CAPITAL. ANECDOTES, INCIDENTS, RUMORS, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Among our " moving accidents" by fire, the most conspicuous has been a conflagation in the steamship-yard, last Saturday on the premises of SCOTT, RUSSELL Co., at Mill Wall, Poplar. This was no common conflagration, seeing that the property destored amounts to about 100,000.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: JAMBS G. KING, Esq., Principal of the Banking House of JAMES G. KING SONS, Wall-street, New-York, died yesterday morning, at his residence, in Weehawken, on the Jersey shore, and in the 63d year of his age.
docs.snippet: JAMBS G. KING, Esq., Principal of the Banking House of JAMES G. KING  SONS, Wall-street, New-York, died yesterday morning, at his residence, in Weehawken, on the Jersey shore, and in the 63d year of his age.
